definition: newsletter/the news in brief/(Tw) SMS message
simple/uncomplicated/letter/to choose/to select/bamboo strips used for writing (old)

sentences.english: Anti-Spam feature blocks annoying ad calls and SMSs.
sentences.chinese: 防垃圾郵件功能會阻止惱人的廣告電話和手機簡訊。

sentences.english: Do you often receive unwamount totd text messaged on your cell phone?
sentences.chinese: 你的手機能否通常收到不想要的簡訊？

sentences.english: If you could at least reply a SMS, or leave message n the MSN, and give me a phone call sometimes.
sentences.chinese: 如果你肯至少回一封簡訊，給我一個留言，一通電話。

sentences.english: The indictments by text messages are not intended to take people by surprise.
sentences.chinese: 以手機簡訊傳達起訴書目的並非讓人大喫一驚。

sentences.english: Gina almost killed us driving over here, she was DWT.
sentences.chinese: 來的路上吉娜差點害死我們，她邊開車邊發簡訊。

sentences.english: Publish a newsletter that helps people understand what you do and why.
sentences.chinese: 發佈簡訊，幫助人們瞭解你們開展的工作及其意義。

sentences.english: John uses his cell phone to send text messaged to his friends.
sentences.chinese: 約翰用手機傳簡訊給他的友人。

sentences.english: It spans email as well as IM, text messages, and on-Facebook messages.
sentences.chinese: 它涵蓋的範圍包括即時通，簡訊和臉書訊息。

definition: to take the initiative/to do sth of one's own accord/spontaneous/active/opposite: passive 被動|被动[bei4 dong4]/drive (of gears and shafts etc)
connection/contact/relation/to get in touch with/to integrate/to link/to touch

incoming telegram or telephone call/your telegram, telephone call, or message/to send a telegram or make a telephone call here (i.e. to the speaker)/to have instant attraction to sb/to have chemistry with sb/to come back (of electricity, after an outage)
to get in touch with/to contact/to stay in contact (with)/liaison/(math.) connection
to give one's respects/to send a greeting/(fig.) (coll.) to make offensive reference to (somebody dear to the person to whom one is speaking)
